      actualValue - the actual value (calculated data) of this assertion

    • assertFileExists

      public static void assertFileExists​(java.lang.String fileFolderName, java.lang.String fileName, java.lang.String... customLogMessage)
      Asserts that a certain file exists. Attempts to find the file only once.
      Parameters:
      fileFolderName - The location of the folder that contains the target file, relative to the project's root folder, ending with a /
      fileName - The name of the target file (including its extension if any)
      customLogMessage - a custom message that will appended to this step in the execution report

    • assertFileExists

      public static void assertFileExists​(java.lang.String fileFolderName, java.lang.String fileName, int numberOfRetries, java.lang.String... customLogMessage)
      Asserts that a certain file exists. Attempts to find the file for the desired NumberOfRetries.
      Parameters:
      fileFolderName - The location of the folder that contains the target file, relative to the project's root folder, ending with a /
      fileName - The name of the target file (including its extension if any)
      numberOfRetries - number of times to try to find the file, given that each retry is separated by a 500 millisecond wait time
      customLogMessage - a custom message that will appended to this step in the execution report

    • assertFileExists

      public static void assertFileExists​(java.lang.String fileFolderName, java.lang.String fileName, int numberOfRetries, Assertions.AssertionType assertionType, java.lang.String... customLogMessage)
      Asserts that a certain file exists if AssertionType is POSITIVE, or doesn't exist if AssertionType is NEGATIVE. Attempts to find the file for the desired NumberOfRetries.
      Parameters:
      fileFolderName - The location of the folder that contains the target file, relative to the project's root folder, ending with a /
      fileName - The name of the target file (including its extension if any)
      numberOfRetries - number of times to try to find the file, given that each retry is separated by a 500 millisecond wait time
      assertionType - AssertionType.POSITIVE, NEGATIVE
      customLogMessage - a custom message that will appended to this step in the execution report

    • assertJSONFileContent

      public static void assertJSONFileContent​(io.restassured.response.Response response, java.lang.String referenceJsonFilePath, RestActions.ComparisonType comparisonType, java.lang.String... customLogMessage)
      Asserts that the API Response object matches the expected referenceJsonFile.
      Parameters:
      response - the full response object returned by performRequest method.
      referenceJsonFilePath - the full absolute path to the test data file that will be used as a reference for this comparison
      comparisonType - ComparisonType.EQUALS, CONTAINS, MATCHES, EQUALS_STRICT; Note that MATCHES ignores the content ordering inside the JSON
      customLogMessage - a custom message that will appended to this step in the execution report

    • assertJSONFileContent

      public static void assertJSONFileContent​(io.restassured.response.Response response, java.lang.String referenceJsonFilePath, RestActions.ComparisonType comparisonType, Assertions.AssertionType assertionType, java.lang.String... customLogMessage)
      Asserts that the API Response object matches the expected referenceJsonFile if AssertionType is POSITIVE, or doesn't match it if AssertionType is NEGATIVE.
      Parameters:
      response - the full response object returned by performRequest method.
      referenceJsonFilePath - the full absolute path to the test data file that will be used as a reference for this comparison
      comparisonType - ComparisonType.EQUALS, CONTAINS, MATCHES, EQUALS_STRICT; Note that MATCHES ignores the content ordering inside the JSON
      assertionType - AssertionType.POSITIVE, NEGATIVE
      customLogMessage - a custom message that will appended to this step in the execution report

    • assertJSONFileContent

      public static void assertJSONFileContent​(io.restassured.response.Response response, java.lang.String referenceJsonFilePath, RestActions.ComparisonType comparisonType, java.lang.String jsonPathToTargetArray, java.lang.String... customLogMessage)
      Asserts that the target array extracted by parsing the API Response object matches the expected referenceJsonFile.
      Parameters:
      response - the full response object returned by performRequest method.
      referenceJsonFilePath - the full absolute path to the test data file that will be used as a reference for this comparison
      comparisonType - ComparisonType.EQUALS, CONTAINS, MATCHES, EQUALS_STRICT; Note that MATCHES ignores the content ordering inside the JSON
      jsonPathToTargetArray - a jsonpath that will be parsed to point to the target JSON Array
      customLogMessage - a custom message that will appended to this step in the execution report

      Asserts that the current image of the target element matches the expected reference image if AssertionType is POSITIVE, or doesn't match it if AssertionType is NEGATIVE. Uses OpenCV natively.
      Parameters:
      driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
      elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
      assertionType - AssertionType.POSITIVE, NEGATIVE
      customLogMessage - a custom message that will appended to this step in * the execution report

    • assertElementMatches

      public static void assertElementMatches​(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator, Assertions.VisualValidationEngine visualValidationEngine, java.lang.String... customLogMessage)
      Asserts that the current image of the target element matches the expected reference image using the desired VisualValidationEngine. Supports OpenCV natively, and Applitools Eyes. To use Eyes you need to configure your applitoolsApiKey in the path.properties file
      Parameters:
      driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
      elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
      visualValidationEngine - VisualValidationEngine.EXACT_OPENCV, EXACT_EYES, STRICT_EYES, CONTENT_EYES, LAYOUT_EYES
      customLogMessage - a custom message that will appended to this step in * the execution report

    • assertElementMatches

      public static void assertElementMatches​(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator, Assertions.VisualValidationEngine visualValidationEngine, Assertions.AssertionType assertionType, java.lang.String... customLogMessage)
      Asserts that the current image of the target element matches the expected reference image using the desired VisualValidationEngine if AssertionType is POSITIVE, or doesn't match it if AssertionType is NEGATIVE. Supports OpenCV natively, and Applitools Eyes. To use Eyes you need to configure your applitoolsApiKey in the path.properties file
      Parameters:
      driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
      elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
      visualValidationEngine - VisualValidationEngine.EXACT_OPENCV, EXACT_EYES, STRICT_EYES, CONTENT_EYES, LAYOUT_EYES
      assertionType - AssertionType.POSITIVE, NEGATIVE
      customLogMessage - a custom message that will appended to this step in * the execution report
